bibl.title: K. al-ʿAbādilah
كتاب العبادله
Kitab Kalām al ʿAbādilah fi-l haqāʾiq al-Asmā: Kitab Jam‘ kalām al-ʿAbādila: Sarḥ al-ʿAbādila: Kitab alsinat al-ʿAdādila: Kitab al-ʿIbad
Book of the Servants of God
bibl.explicit: Closing Words of Text (exclusive of any rubric or colophon which might follow it).
bibl.author: Ibn al-ʿArabī
bibl.date: Terminus post quem and terminus ante quem
bibl.note: Date or place of composition is not known. But it must be before 626H, as there is a samāʿ on Shehit Ali 2826 dated 22nd of Dhū al-Ḥijja 626H.

noteGrp.note: A treatise on the servants of God according to the different character traits (akhlāq) of the perfect human being (al-insān al-kāmil). Each servant (ʿabd Allāh) represents a spiritual modality symbolised by the association of a Divine Name and the name of a particular prophet or saint. The work is in two parts; the first consisting of 50 ʿabādila divided into five sections, the second of 67. Pablo Beneito supports Michel Chodkiewicz in relating the first 114 to the 114 suras of the Qurʾān.

bibl.note: OY lists 16 mss., at least seven of which can be considered historic. The best is Yusuf Aga 4859, a partial holograph with a samāʿ dated 641H. Different copies have different numbers of chapters: Ayasofia 4817 and Yusuf Aga 4859 have 117, Shehit Ali 2826 114, the Cairo printed edition (1969) 96. According to Pablo Beneito, who has made a detailed study of the text, 117 is the correct number.
